alert.note: Alert for City of Fredericksburg; Stafford (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 5:25PM EST until January 11 at 5:43AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and northern Virginia, including the following counties, in central Virginia, City of Fredericksburg, King George and Spotsylvania. In northern Virginia, Stafford. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 525 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stafford... Fredericksburg... King George... Dahlgren... Fairview Beach... Potomac Creek... Massaponax... Spotsylvania... Falmouth... Passapatanzy... Spring Valley... Brookfield... Holly Corner... Leeland... Chancellorsville... Glendie... Stones Corner... White Oak... Hartwood... Thornburg... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
